remarks: An epimorphism is a morphism.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)
statement:
isepi.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
isepi.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
isepi.o $e |- .x. = ( comp ` C ) $.
isepi.e $e |- E = ( Epi ` C ) $.
isepi.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
isepi.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
isepi.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
epihom $p |- ( ph -> ( X E Y ) C_ ( X H Y ) ) $.
